param.name: min_pres
param.label: Minimal signal presence [fraction of scans]
param.help: The minimum proportion of presence in the time period for a series of signals grouped by m/z to be considered a peak.

param.name: min_run
param.label: Minimal elution time [unit corresponds to the retention time]
param.help: The minimum length of elution time for a series of signals grouped by m/z to be considered a peak.

param.name: mz_tol
param.label: m/z tolerance [ppm]
param.help: The m/z tolerance level for the grouping of data points. This value is expressed as the fraction of the m/z value. This value, multiplied by the m/z value, becomes the cutoff level. The recommended value is the machine's nominal accuracy level (e.g. for FTMS, it is 10).

param.name: baseline_correct
param.label: Baseline correction [unit of signal intensity]
param.help: After grouping the observations, the highest intensity in each group is found. If the highest is lower than this value, the entire group will be deleted.

param.name: grouping_threshold
param.label: Grouping Threshold [unit corresponds to the retention time]
param.help: Maximum empty space between section of the chromatogram for splitting EICs

param.name: intensity_weighted
param.label: Weight intensity
param.help: Whether to weight the local density by signal intensities in initial peak detection.

param.name: BIC_factor
param.label: BIC factor
param.help: A factor influencing Bayesian information criterion (BIC) in estimation of RT peak shape. If the value is larger than 1, models with more peaks are penalized more.

param.name: component_eliminate
param.label: Component eliminate
param.help: In fitting mixture of bi-Gaussian model of an EIC, when a component accounts for a proportion of intensities less than this value, the component will be ignored.

param.name: sigma_ratio_lim_min
param.label: Minimal sigma ratio
param.help: The lower limit of the ratio range between the left-standard deviation and the right-standard deviation of the bi-Gaussian function to fit the data.

param.name: sigma_ratio_lim_max
param.label: Maximal sigma ratio
param.help: The upper limit of the ratio range between the left-standard deviation and the right-standard deviation of the bi-Gaussian function to fit the data.

param.name: sd_cut_bounds
param.label: Standard deviations boundaries.
param.help: Limit the standard deviations by setting boundaries.

param.name: sd_cut_min
param.label: Minimal standard deviation
param.help: The minimum standard deviation - features with a standard deviation lower than this number are eliminated.

param.name: sd_cut_max
param.label: Maximal standard deviation
param.help: The maximum standard deviation - features with a standard deviation greater than this number are eliminated.

param.name: peak_estim_method
param.label: Peak estimation method
param.help: The estimation method for parameters of the bi-Gaussian peak model. Two possible algorithms: moment and EM (expectation maximization).

param.name: moment_power
param.label: Moment power
param.help: The power parameter for data transformation when fitting the bi-Gaussian mixture model in an EIC.

param.name: mz_tol_relative_ppm
param.label: Relative m/z tolerance [ppm]
param.help: Relative m/z tolerance to use for grouping features.

param.name: rt_tol
param.label: Retention time tolerance [unit corresponds to the retention time]
param.help: Retention time tolerance to use for grouping features.

param.name: mz_tol
param.label: m/z tolerance [ppm]
param.help: The m/z tolerance level for the grouping of data points. This value is expressed as the fraction of the m/z value. This value, multiplied by the m/z value, becomes the cutoff level. The recommended value is the machine's nominal accuracy level (e.g. for FTMS, it is 10).

param.name: recover_mz_range
param.label: Range for m/z recovery [ppm]
param.help: The m/z around the feature m/z to search for observations. If not given, 1.5 times the m/z tolerance in the aligned object will be used.

param.name: recover_rt_range
param.label: Range for rt recovery [unit of retention time]
param.help: The retention time around the feature retention time to search for observations. If not given, 0.5 times the retention time tolerance in the aligned object will be used.

param.name: use_observed_range
param.label: Use observed rt range
param.help: Use the minimal and maximal rt values per feature.

param.name: recover_min_count
param.label: Minimal count to recover
param.help: The minimum number of raw data points to be considered as a true feature.

param.name: intensity_weighted
param.label: Weight intensity
param.help: Whether to weight the local density by signal intensities in initial peak detection.

param.name: bandwidth
param.label: Bandwidth factor
param.help: Parameter used to scale down the overall range of retention times (the bandwidth) assumed in the kernel smoother used for peak identification. The value is between zero and one. The minimal and maximal bandwidth can be limited by explicit values.

param.name: min_bandwidth
param.label: Minimal bandwidth [unit corresponds to the retention time]
param.help: The lower limit on the resulting bandwidth. If not given, it is estimated based on the overall range of retention times in the profile.

param.name: max_bandwidth
param.label: Maximal bandwidth [unit corresponds to the retention time]
param.help: The upper limit on the resulting bandwidth. If not given, it is estimated based on the overall range of retention times in the profile
